title: Conservation Practices from Farms to Forests and Wetlands

tasks.task: Attend Farm Bill Conservation Practices Briefing
subtasks: Listen to introductory remarks by Dan Persett
Acknowledge Congressional guests Representative Nancy Mace and Representative Sharice Davids
Review American Farmland Trust's role in promoting soil health and conservation practices
Understand the definition of soil health and its benefits
Discuss barriers to adopting soil health practices and identified programs supporting them (CRP, EQIP, CSP, RCPP, ASAP)
Address challenges in accessing conservation programs and funding needs
Examine floodplain easements through American Rivers' perspective on program effectiveness and unmet demand
Highlight Latino Climate Council's efforts in integrating social equity and food security through agroecology practices
Present case studies of agroecological farms in Puerto Rico focusing on biodiversity, soil health, and water management
Discuss the challenges faced by Tribal communities in conservation efforts, emphasizing engagement, capacity building, and self-determination
Conclude with panelists' recommendations for improvement and the importance of tribal involvement in conservation programs
